content: This currently translates to ∀ x, x > 0..., but it turns out to be easy to turn it into ∀ x, 0 < x...instead. How do people feel about that? See https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/5526
It would be nice if the unexpander/delaborator (if/once we have any) will also shorten it in the reverse direction.
Oh yeah, I was thinking about that too but got distracted. Do you know where that code is?
I thought one of the strengths of Lean4 was that we could now use < and > interchangeably, and there wouldn't be issues where they lead to syntactic mismatch.
I hadn't heard that (and in my experience, it's not true)
